question_text: Why might a system include two 16 GB memory modules instead of a single 32 GB module?
answer_options: It lowers the total power consumption
It enables dual-channel memory support for increased bandwidth
It allows the system to boot faster
It helps prevent overheating of the memory
correct_answer: It enables dual-channel memory support for increased bandwidth
explanation: Using two matched memory modules allows a system to operate in dual-channel mode, which improves memory throughput compared to a single module.
